poem:
**Shift in the Commons**

Morning's ink announces
a turn of tide—comprehensives
crackle like fresh paper, 
the corridors echo
no longer with the whispers 
of ancient ties.

Keir's voice lifts a corner 
of the weary sky,
weaving the new patchwork 
of a future, where change breathes 
not just in speeches 
but in the shoed footsteps 
of the many.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labour wins UK general election as Keir Starmer says: ‘We did it! Change begins now’ – live 9.05am BST Richard Adams is the Guardian’s education editor Analysis by the Sutton Trust suggests that Keir Starmer’s cabinet will have the highest number of ministers educated at comprehensive schools, and the lowest proportion in modern history who went to private schools. Based on Labour’s shadow cabinet, 84% went to comprehensive schools, 10% went to private schools and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
